summary: Over 7 million Americans are blind or visually impaired and may have trouble reading the labels on prescription drug containers. We found that some pharmacies can provide accessible labels in audible, braille, and large print formats but dispensed very few prescriptions with these labels. We also found that the National Council on Disability has conducted limited activities to inform pharmacies and the public about best...
title: Prescription Drug Labels: Actions Needed to Increase Awareness of Best Practices for Accessible Labels for Individuals Who are Blind or Visually Impaired
